title: Lights, camera, Trump: Get ready for the Donald Trump-James Comey miniseries
text:
CLOSE

James Comey and Donald Trump (Photo: NICHOLAS KAMM, AFP/Getty Images)

WASHINGTON – The saga of President Donald Trump and fired FBI Director James Comey will soon hit the small screen as a television miniseries, CBS Studios announced Monday.

Comey will be portrayed by Jeff Daniels, most recently idealistic anchorman Will McAvoy in the HBO series "The Newsroom," as well as idealistic Southern lawyer Atticus Finch in the Broadway production of "To Kill A Mockingbird."

Who plays Trump?

The distinguished Irish actor Brendan Gleeson, who won an Emmy for his portrayal of Winston Churchill in the 2009 HBO film "Into The Storm."

The new miniseries is based on Comey's memoir, “A Higher Loyalty: Truth, Lies and Leadership.”

Trump said he fired Comey in 2017 for incompetence; Comey said Trump sacked him because he refused the president's request to back off an investigation of adviser Michael Flynn, a key figure in the investigation of Russian election interference in 2016.

Filming is scheduled to begin next month, CBS said; the actual air date will be announced later.
